properties.areaDesc: Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet
properties.senderName: NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 10 at 6:00AM MST until February 12 at 5:00AM MST by NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM EXPECTED TO BRING HEAVY SNOW OVER MOUNTAIN AREAS...

. Upper level closed low is expected to combine with a strong cold
front to bring winter weather conditions over the Gila Region and
Sacramento Mountains from Monday night through early Wednesday
morning. Temperatures will drop below freezing on Monday
evening/early Tuesday morning which will allow the transition
from rain to snow. Periods of moderate to heavy snow are possible
with this system from Monday night through Wednesday morning. Snow
accumulations are expected to be between 6 to 10(+) inches in the
Sacramento Mountains, and areas above 7500 feet in the Gila
Region, with isolated higher amounts. The snow should end by
Wednesday morning.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12
inches, with locally higher amounts possible.

* WHERE...Portions of south central New Mexico.

* WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 5 AM MST Wednesday.

* TIMING... Occasional moderate to heavy snow through late early
Wednesday morning.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 AM MST WEDNESDAY
